supplement_recommendations.frequency: Once daily, preferably in the evening or before bedtime with food
supplement_recommendations.why: Magnesium supports migraine prevention by stabilizing neuronal excitability according to strong evidence in migraine management.
Riboflavin is clinically proven to reduce the frequency and severity of migraines by improving mitochondrial energy metabolism.

supplement_recommendations.frequency: Once daily, preferably taken with a meal containing fat
supplement_recommendations.why: CoQ10 enhances mitochondrial function, which is associated with reduction in migraine frequency, backed by evidence.
Omega-3s provide anti-inflammatory benefits and may decrease the inflammatory cascade linked to migraines.
Vitamin D is implicated in modulating inflammation and preventing migraines, especially given its widespread deficiency in adults.
Niacin supports migraine prevention by promoting vasodilation and improved cerebral blood flow.
Butterbur is an herbal remedy with strong evidence for reducing migraine frequency without significant side effects.
Feverfew has evidence for preventing migraines by regulating serotonin release and reducing vascular spasms.

supplement_recommendations.frequency: Once or twice daily with meals
supplement_recommendations.why: Curcumin offers anti-inflammatory and antioxidant support, which may contribute to migraine prevention and general wellness.
Chromium contributes to blood sugar regulation, which may support migraine management by stabilizing glucose levels.
